result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) .10. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) .10 was dismissed by the court.

  • William E. Todd was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
8:50 a.m. Defendant William E. Todd in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek/Burns/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing. 
Court Sentence
State Prison - 5 years - Imposed and Stayed
  Initial Confinement - 2 years
  Extended Supervision - 3 years

POP- 3 years
Jail - 1 year with Huber for all purposes. May serve in Marathon County.  To commence on/before 5:00 p.m. on January 27, 2017
Good time credited as a condition of probation.
Fine - $2655 plus blood draw surcharge
Driver's License revoked - 3 years
IID - 3 years
AODA assessment
Driver's Safety Plan
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Jail credit  - 1 day if revoked
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Cash bond posted to be applied.
Appeal rights given. NADVI given. 
Adj. 9:10 a.m.  Review hearing scheduled for December 18, 2018 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for William E. Todd
Current: 702 1/2 Lincoln Avenue, Wausau, WI 54403 United States  (Effective: 12-21-2016)
Prior: 3957 Trails End Road, Rhinelander, WI 54501

9:07 a.m. Day 2 of jury trial. Defendant William E. Todd in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Breanna Magllones also present in court. Jurors not present. Defendant will not be testifying - waiver free and voluntary. Attorney Schiek statement to discussion held in chambers regarding audio tapes from March, 2016 from ONSO - Burns statement. Court finds that evidence was discovered too late and will not be allowed today unless used for cross examination of a witness. 
9:14 a.m. - Jurrors present. Defense rests. Schiek calls D.J./sworn/direct by Schiek- Exhibit 16 (time card) marked - continued direct by Schiek/State moves to admit Exhibit 16 - granted/cross by Burns. Schiek recalls L.S./sworn/direct by Schiek. State recalls S.K./sworn/direct by Schiek/cross by Burns. State recalls S.J./sworn/direct by Schiek/cross by Burns. State recalls R.U./sworn/direct by Schiek/cross by Burns/redirect by Schiek/recross by Burns. State rests on rebuttal. Court statement to jury. Jurors out at 9:34 a.m. Court statement to jury instruction preparation. Schiek moves to admit Exhibit 13 - Granted. Schiek statement to sweatshirts being shown by defense should be marked in some form as Exhibits. Parties will stipulate on manner of Exhibits. Adj. 9:36 a.m. 
On record at 10:28 a.m. Jurors not present. Jury instruction conference held. Instructions to be given - 100, 145, 2669 as modified, 140, 147, 148, 103, 170, 141, 155, 157, 200, 300, 315, 325, 160, 460, 515 and proposed jury verdict. Discussion. Counsel stipulates. Off record.
10:38 a.m. Jurors return. Court instructs jury. 
10:53 a.m. Closing Statement - Schiek
11:16 a.m. - Closing Statement - Burns
11:30 a.m. - Rebuttal - Schiek
11:32 a.m. - Court gives remaining instructions to jury. Alternate juror - #727 chosen; released
11:36 Jurors released for deliberation
11:40 a.m. - On record - jurors not present - Court statement to modifications to jury instructions - copies provided to counsel - Burns indicates on Exhibits date photos taken - Schiek has no objections. Photo exhibits will be provided to jury. Recess 11:43 a.m. 
12:12 p.m. - Jurors return. Court reads verticts - Jury finds defendant guilty  of Count 1 and guilty of  Count 2. Counsel does not want jury polled. Court statement to jurors. 12:14 p.m. - jurors excused. Burns questions whether defendant will remain on bond - PSI not requested by either party. Counsel to meet at Branch 1 JA's desk for sentencing date. Bail continued. Adj. 12:16 pm.

8:32 a.m. In Chambers - present - Michael William Schiek, Mary L. Roth Burns, Breanna Magallones. Schiek provides Exhibit 1 (Certified Driving Record) - marked, received. Court discussion regarding jury instruction #50 - will be given by Court. 
8:57 a.m. 
Defendant William E. Todd in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also present in court, Attorney Breanna Magallones.
Case called. All jurors sworn - 23 jurors called. 
08:59 a.m. Introduction of counsel - Schiek 
09:01 a.m. Introduction of counsel - Burns 
9:01 a.m. Voir Dire by Court 9:12 a.m. - Voir Dire by Schiek
9:25 a.m. Voir Dire by Burns; #971 stricken for cause - #1113 called. Continued Voir Dire by Court and Burns. Court discussion regarding elements of case and juror's responsibility. 
9:45 a.m. Peremptory strikes commencing - Court gives preliminary jury instructions
9:53 a.m. 13 jurors selected/sworn to serve on trial 9:56 a.m. - jurors excused. Recess.
10:10 a.m. - Jurors not present. Defendant and counsel present. Schiek statement to witness C.S.; Off record. On record 10:14 a.m. 
10:15 a.m. - Jurors in. Opening statement by Schiek. 
10:23 a.m. - Opening by Burns.
10:29 a.m. - State calls S.K./sworn/direct by Schiek/cross by Burns/Burns marks Exhibits 2, 3 and 4 (photos)/continued cross - Side Bar - Schiek - no redirect but reserves witness for rebuttal. State calls S.J./sworn/direct by Schiek/cross by Burns/Schiek reserves right to call as rebuttal. State calls R.U./sworn/direct by Schiek/cross by Burns/Schiek reserves right to call as rebuttal. State calls C.S./sworn/direct by Schiek/witness ID's defendant/redirect by Schiek. Court recesses for lunch. Jurors out at 11:33 a.m. Will resume at 1:00 p.m. 
1:05 p.m. - Back on record. Exhibits 5-10 marked by State. 1:10 p.m. Jurors return. State calls Rhinelander Police Department Sgt. Michael Allard/sworn/direct by Schiek. Schiek moves to admit Exhibit 6 - granted. Exhibit 6 published to jury.  Continued direct by Schiek - Schiek moves to admit Exhibits 5, 7-10 - granted. Exhibits published to jury. Continued direct by Schiek/Exhibits 11 (photo) and 12 (DVD) marked. Schiek moves to admit Exhibit 11 - Granted. publishes to jury. Exhibit 12 (DVD) played for jury. Off record while DVD is played 1:33 p.m. On record 1:36 p.m. Schiek statement - started DVD at beginning - played through 2 min 30 sec/continued direct by Schiek - Exhibit 13 (Informing the Accused) marked/continued direct by Schiek/ witness ID's defendant /State moves to admit Exhibits 11 and 12 - Granted. Cross by Burns. Redirect by Schiek. State calls Rhinelander Police Dept Detective Sgt Joshua Chiamulera/sworn/direct by Schiek/cross by Burns. State calls Stephanie Weber, Wisconsin State Lab analyst/sworn/Exhibits 14 (Submission to lab form) and 15 (lab results) marked/direct by Schiek. Witness is excused. State moves to admit Exhibits 14 and 15 - Granted. Recess 2:18 Jury out. 
2:36 pm - Jurors return. State rests. Burns calls A.B./sworn/direct by Burns/cross by Schiek/redirect by Burns/Court questions witness.  Burns calls J.M./sworn/direct by Burns/cross by Schiek. Burns calls T.L.T./sworn/direct by Burns/cross by Schiek - Side bar - continued cross by Schiek/redirect by Burns. Burns calls L.S./sworn/direct by Burns/cross by Schiek. Side bar. Court addresses jury. Jury excused at 3:49 pm. Adj. 3:50 p.m.

3:05 p.m. Attorney Mary L. Roth Burns in court. Defendant does not appear. Michael Schiek, DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court statement--speaks to motion challenging proposed JI 172/Change of Appearance. Schiek statement in support. Burns objects; speaks to JI 141 as better instruction/Court statement--reads from case cited by Burns; speaks to defendant's change in appearance. Schiek requests identification clarification. Court to hear evidence. 

Other Acts Evidence/Prior convictions - Burns points out clarification in #2 on State's Motion should be 2006, not 2016; noted by the Court. Burns statement as to Meirhofer too remote in time; Schiek statement/credibility and relevance; should be able to ask questions. Court statement--speaks to considerations /references Kuntz case; Meirhofer-answer 2. Court statement-William Todd/not allowing a, b, c, and d - answer 4. Court statement/Bozicevich-allowing a, c, and e - answer 3. Schiek statement--certified driving abstract/presented at trial. Burns to advise witnesses of proper answers. Schiek/Burns statement. Court rulling - Defense MIL 1 granted; witnesses sequestered both sides; MIL 5, Burns reserves rights. 3:38 p.m adj.
from Defense counsel objecting to State's Jury Instruction

11:05 a.m. Defendant William E. Todd in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Burns/Schiek statement to motion. Court finds identification is not police related and therefore not suggestive. Burns further statement. Court finds it is a jury question and jury instruction will be provided to address issue. Court will allow adult witness to testify. Court will allow minors to testify as to what they observed prior to "show-up".  Court expects jury instruction numbers provided within next week unless standard instruction is modified- then counsel should provide modification language. Any unique motions to be provided to Court prior to trial. Schiek motion to suppression of witnesses - minors may be allowed in courtroom for defense case - may be recalled as rebuttal witnesses. Court takes motion to id by minors after State's case under advisement.  State to provide video evidence - Burns/Schiek to stipulate to portions of video and arrange for video equipment in courtroom. Bail continued. Adj. 11:32 a.m.
Jury trial on December 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

2:50 p.m. Defendant William E. Todd in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Burns statement that has not been resolved - requests trial date. Bail continued. Adj. 2:54 p.m.  Jury trial scheduled for September 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Black's Law Dictionary definition of showup

9:02 a.m. Defendant William E. Todd in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  DA intern, Eric Klemm, under the student practice rule appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State calls Sgt. Michael Allard, Rhinelander PD. Witness sworn/direct by State. Attorney Mary Sowinski now appears for the State of Wisconsin. Cross by Defense. Exhibit 1 marked (copy of Black's Law Dictionary definition of showup) - received. Defense continues cross examination. Court questions witness. Court/Burns/Klemm discussion. Court states issue before Court is whether Officer standing next to defendant is suggestive to witnesses - total identification of defendant was proper - Court suppresses statements made by young witnesses brought out of bar to identify defendant while outside - statements made inside bar are admissable. Burns moves that witnesses are tainted for testimony at trial - Court will consider matter and rule at trial. Adj. 9:29 a.m.
State's Response to Defendant's Motion to Suppress
Motion hearing on June 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.

11:09 a.m. Defendant William E. Todd in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State calls Sgt Michael Allard, Rhinelander Police Department. Witness sworn/direct by Schiek/witness ID's defendant/cross by Burns/redirect by Schiek/re-cross by Burns. Based on testimony, Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over. State intends on filing Information that mirrors Complaint - Burns statement that willing to proceed to arraignment. Burns enters not guilty pleas to all counts. Bail continued. Adj. 11:30 a.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 5, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 4, 2016 at 11:00 am.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

1:52 p.m. Defendant William E. Todd in court, in custody, via video. Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mary Burns in court on behalf of defendant - has not spoken to defendant. In receipt of complaint, waive reading - Burns/Schiek statement to bond. Schiek moves to redact names of minors in police report attached to Complaint - Granted. Court orders jail to redact names in Defendant's copy; instructs Attorney Burns to redact her copy-Clerk to redact original. Defendant statement to Utah charges as 3rd arrest. Set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived. Court sets $1000 cash bond. Adj. 2:03 pm. 
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2016 at 09:00 am.
